pullRequest.title: Fix incorrect signature in _classByNameMap cache
pullRequest.bodyText:
_classByNameMap was using the signature of a class as part of the key,
but when deleting from the cache, the name of a class was used, which is slightly different.
Because of that most unloaded classes were not removed from the cache,
causing segfaults. This commit fixes the issue by transforming
the name into signature before deleting and renaming the cache appropriately.

beforeCommit.message:
Fix bugs in _classByNameMap cache

- _classByNameMap was using the signature of a class as part of the key,
but when deleting from the cache, the name of a class was used, which is slightly different.
Because of that most unloaded classes were not removed from the cache,
causing segfaults. This commit fixes the issue by transforming
the name into signature before deleting.
- Class loaders of the referencing constant pool and the actual
resulting class
were assumed to be the same but that it is not always the case.
This commit adds code to use the correct class loader during
caching.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: We don't need to terminate the string with NULL.

commit.message:
Fix incorrect signature in _classByNameMap cache

_classByNameMap was using the signature of a class as part of the key,
but when deleting from the cache, the name of a class was used, which is slightly different.
Because of that most unloaded classes were not removed from the cache,
causing segfaults. This commit fixes the issue by transforming
the name into signature before deleting and renaming the cache
appropriately.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>
